Record summer for Helsinki Helpers Published on : Monday, August 31, 2015
This past summer was another record Helsinki Help -matkailuneuvojille. From June to August they served a total of nearly 166 000 tourists, which is about 4,500 tourists more than in the previous summer. A major Gymnaestrada raised the amount of contacts in July, but good growth was also during numerous events have provided August.
Helsinki Helpers are already behind on 21 June its management of the service as foreign than domestic tourists pair of city services and summer experiences. In June, the level remained below last year’s service contacts, however, and in July the month of August there were almost 3900 more than in 2014.
The summer was marked by a major event in particular Gymnaestrada in July, which brought Helsinki about 21 000 gymnasts and his entourage. The majority of the clientele is, however, cruise ship passengers. About 90 per cent of the Helsinki Help Small customers are foreigners.
– Patrolling diligently major international Gymnastics Event venues, which brought certainly an element in number of customers of July. We were also, as usual, greeted by all the international cruise ships and also to the train station we reached a particularly great advice for tourists in need, tell the Helsinki Help Small supervisors Krista Kaipainen and Lotta Peltola.
Tourists served this summer 26 Helppiä, who patrol the streets 12.6.-23.8. Helsinki Helpers have been serving tourists from the Info Container, which was located this year in a new place central street, between Ateneum and Makkaratalo. The new location has sought to respond better to the railway station environment, the need for advice. Info Container will remain open 14.9. until now.
Helsinki Helpers is mainly funded by the City of Helsinki, but the company partners are playing an increasingly important role in enabling activities. This year, the partners reached a record high of 25 pieces: Ateneum Art Museum, Hard Rock Café, Helsinki Lines, JT-Line, Strömma, Music, Linnanmäki, Helsinki City Marketing, Helsinki Festival, A & S Restaurants, Art Hall, Fiskars Home, Bear, Market Quarter, Tallink Silja, Sea Life, Halti, Kankurin room Visit Porvoo, DNA, Finlandia restaurant, HOK-Elanto, Santa Claus Licensing, Military Museum and Viking Line.
